meanings.definition: One who bribes or induces someone to commit a wrongful act.
meanings.sent1: The suborner offered money to make the person do something wrong.
meanings.sent2: The police caught the suborner who was trying to persuade others to break the law.
meanings.sent3: The suborner thought he could get away with his sneaky plan, but justice caught up with him.
meanings.sent4: The suborner's actions were like a dark shadow tempting others to step into the wrong path.
meanings.sent5: The image of the suborner lingered in the minds of those who refused to be swayed by dishonest offers.
